logs_dashboards_description: Dashboards are graphical representations of your logs. Thanks to the various modules (curves, pie charts, counters, statistics, etc.), you get a synthetic view of your data. How many errors have occurred over the past 24 hours? Are they increasing or decreasing? Which page has received the largest number of hits today?  How many customers have you had this month? All that information can be accessed immediately. You can have different tables that will allow you to display your data based on specific contexts, thereby making the information more legible.

logs_welcome_title: Logs Data Platform is a logs management system designed by OVH
logs_welcome_description_1: Index and analyze your logs in real time. Receive alerts about any downtime. Share your data with your colleagues.
logs_welcome_description_2: Logs Data Platform is a comprehensive platform you can use to manage and analyze your company's logs. You can get an overall view of how well your physical and virtual servers are running. You can also see how well your cloud-based and mobile applications are running. This way, you can anticipate potential incidents, and be notified if your resources experience any downtime.
logs_accounts_description: Logs Data Platform is a comprehensive platform you can use to manage and analyze your company's logs. You can get an overall view of how well your physical and virtual servers are running. You can also see how well your cloud-based and mobile applications are running. This way, you can anticipate potential incidents, and be notified if your resources experience any downtime.

logs_home_info: Logs Data Platform is an interface for gathering, indexing and analyzing logs. Wherever your logs are from, you can use the platform to choose different entry points depending on the protocol, security level and format. You can use and analyze data with the various APIs and web interfaces.

logs_tokens_description: To grant external applications with access to your logs, and to automate certain tasks, you will need to give them access to the APIs. The most secure way to manage this access is by using authentication tokens. By using this feature, you no longer need to enter your credentials into the configuration files.

logs_streams_description: With streams, you can classify your logs into precise categories in real time, as soon as they arrive on the Logs Data Platform. If you have several streams, you can also store messages easily based on their source (the application or server they originated from), and create different levels of confidentiality for different streams, which means you can grant access to authorised people only. Here, the tokens are write tokens, which can be used to direct logs to the appropriate stream. Generally, having multiple streams makes it a lot easier to search your logs, since you no longer need to exclude the results from another system or application.

streams_alerts_intro_text: With alert conditions, you no longer need to monitor your logs because the platform does it for you. Many use cases are likely to trigger an alert and notify you about it by email: the absence of messages coming from a program for an unusual amount of time, an abnormally low number of performed tasks, a very high network traffic on your website, or the appearance of some specific keywords in your stream.
streams_alerts_delete_message: Are you sure you want to delete the {{alert}} alert?
streams_alerts_delete_error: An error occurred while deleting the {{alertName}} alert: {{message}}
streams_alerts_condition_message_count: The alert is lifted when there have been {{thresholdType}} than {{threshold}} message(s) in the last {{time}} minutes. Include {{backlog}} messages in the notification.
streams_alerts_condition_field_value: The alert is lifted when the {{field}} field has had a value {{thresholdType}} {{constraintType}} than {{threshold}} in the last {{time}} minutes. Include {{backlog}} messages in the notification.
streams_alerts_condition_field_content_v: The alert is lifted when a message containing the field {{field}}:"{{value}}" is received. Include {{backlog}} messages in the notification.
add_alert_description_message_count: This condition is enabled when the number of messages is greater than or smaller than the threshold defined for a given period.
add_alert_description_field_value: This condition is triggered when the aggregated value of a field is higher or lower than a defined threshold in a given period of time.
add_alert_description_field_content_valu: This condition is activated when the content of the messages is equal to a set value.
add_alert_time_period_field_description: Assess condition for all messages received in the given number of minutes.
add_alert_threshold_type_field_descripti: Select the condition that activates the alert: when there are more or fewer messages than the threshold.
Select the condition that triggers the alert: when value is higher or lower than the threshold.
add_alert_threshold_field_description: Value that activates the alert if exceeded.
add_alert_grace_period_field_description: Number of minutes to wait after the resolution of an alert before launching another one.
add_alert_accumulation_field_description: Number of messages to include in the notification alerts.
add_alert_notification_field_description: Check this box to send notifications every time the alert condition is met, regardless of its status.
add_alert_constraint_type_field_descript: Select the condition that triggers the alert: when the value is smaller or greater than the threshold.
add_alert_value_field_description: The value that must be compared to the field's value.

inputs_intro_text: Collection tools are programs that allow the retrieval of logs from servers or applications. It is an efficient way of processing and transforming in a GELF format that's compatible with Logs Data Platform. You no longer need to dedicate hardware resources or monitor the availability of your infrastructures because we do it for you. This platform allows you to link these tools to your various streams to simplify and secure your configuration using firewall rules.

logs_index_description: Logs Data Platform lets you create and host Elasticsearch indexes. These indexes can be used for the configuration data of a Kibana instance, indexing your statistical data, and enriching or correlating your logs. You can then use these indexes with most tools and applications that are compatible with the Elasticsearch REST API.
